intro: Aneilema indehiscens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, stocky stem. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals that are fused at the base. Aneilema indehiscens is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
